title: Harsha
summary: Harshavardhana (c. 590â€“647 CE) was an Indian emperor who ruled North India from 606 to 647 CE. He was a member of the Vardhana dynasty; and was the son of Prabhakaravardhana who defeated the Alchon Huna invaders,[6] and the younger brother of Rajyavardhana, a king of Thanesar, present-day Haryana.
